text: Place the chopped potatoes in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring the water to a boil over high heat and reduce to a simmer.
Cook the potatoes until they are fork-tender, about 20-30 minutes.
Drain the potatoes well and return them to the pot.
Add the milk and 2 tablespoons of butter and mash the potatoes until smooth.
Season the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper to taste.
In a separate pan, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over low heat.
Add the finely chopped green onions to the melted butter and sauté for about 2 minutes until softened.
Mix the sautéed green onions into the mashed potatoes, stirring well to combine.
Serve immediately as a side dish or top with shredded cheese if desired.
